result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Bernard Shoemaker

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Bail Modification.  (Willie B. Shoemaker - #2022009482, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss w/Prejudice.  (Willie B. Shoemaker - #2022009482, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Willie Bernard Shoemaker.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel due to a breakdown in communication is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel in Br 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker not in court, in custody. Attorney Arial Rosenberg on behalf of Jason A Findling in court for Willie Bernard Shoemaker.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Case remains set for Motion Hearing and Arraignment on 10/14 at 9:00 am. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 08-19-22 by DEBRA WISNIEWSKI.
Defense filed a Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail.  Court scheduled a bail/bond hearing on September 14, 2022 at 8:30 AM.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail

Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Willie Bernard Shoemaker.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Arraignment. For reasons stated on the record court grants defense request to adjourn hearing and set matter for motion hearing as well as bail/bond hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Bernard Shoemaker appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of Rock County case #18CF628. Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer D. Foy. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motions to dismiss based on the naming and identification of the defedant by the State's Witness. Motion Denied. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an Arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jason Findling

Court ordered no contact with Wendy DN.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker in court with Attorney Theodore Kafkas. Defendant Willie Bernard Shoemaker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Bernard Shoemaker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
